result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Lee Thoreson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Lee Thoreson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Lee Thoreson was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Daniel Lee Thoreson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Meet with DOC representative within 48 hours.

miscConds.notes: Court costs totaling $243.00.  Cash bond applied.  The balance of the cash bond to be applied to 13CM183.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
No abusive contact with Theresa T.  No contact with Kateri B.    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety and no consumption of illegal drugs.

timeConds.notes: Day for day credit for inpatient treatment successfully completed.  38 days to serve shall be served at direction of Agent.  Credit for time served of 142 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel Lee Thoreson
Current: 711 W. Main Street, Ashland, WI 54806 United States  (Effective: 01-30-2015)
Prior: 27 Shadow Drive, Washburn, WI 54891
Received Notice RE Posting Bond from BCSD with receipt and c/b envelope
Notice of Motion and Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection filed by District Attorney
Decision of Administrative Law Judge Kevin M. Schram regarding defendant's revocation of probation.
Exhibit 1-4.  Exhibits 2-4 are photos and are not scanned.
Consent to substitution of attorneys and order

This bond is in effect until disposition of the case or until modified by the court.    We are obtaining your social security number for collection purposes per Wis. Stats. 71.935.  Disclosing your social security number to us is considered voluntary on your part.  Maintain absolute sobriety; not to possess or consume alcohol or drugs other than prescribed by a physician and then take only as prescribed.  Bail Monitoring with the Bayfield County Sheriff's Department every Monday, Wednesday and Friday no later than 1 p.m.; drug and alcohol testing each day presents himself to the Bayfield County Sheriff's Department; Comply with daily curfew of 7:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m.  No contact with Theresa T (victim) or Kateri Bender (co-def), effective immediately whether prior to release from custody or after release from custody.

Defendant Daniel Lee Thoreson in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.   Fred Bourg, DA appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Officer Josh Fleig sworn and questioned by DA.  Exhibits #1 and #2 marked.  Interviewed victim; written statement made (exhibit #1).  Witness identifies exhibit #1 as being the victim's statement.  Witness identifies exhibit #2 (4 pages of photos) as being the photographs taken of the victim during the interview, 09-20-2014.  Less detail of the injuries are shown in the photos; more detail seen with own eyes.  
Cross by Atty Rafferty.  Exhibit #3 marked, photo of victim; blowup, identified by Witness.  Exhibit #4 marked, photo of victim; blowup, identified by Witness.  Exhibits #3 and #4 rec'd by the Court with no objection.  
Re-direct by DA Bourg.  Verbal threat was made as well as physical harm against victim.  
Re-cross by Atty Rafferty.  Met with victim only once.  Interview was approximately 13 hours after the incident.  
State has no further witnesses.
Theresa Thoreson sworn and questioned by Atty Rafferty.  Identifies defendant as her son.  Did not call 911 over this incident.  Was under the influence when met with Officer Fleig.  Witness reviews exhibits #3 and #4; she is the one shown in the photos.  Son stopped her from leaving his residence because he did not want her to get hurt.  Was free to leave.  He did not punch her.
DA asks the Judge to advise witness of her rights; rights given to witness.  Break taken for law research at 1:34 p.m.  Back on the record at 1:46 p.m.  DA explains case law as he understands it.  Questioning continues; DA questions witness.  Do not recall meeting with Officer Pilath in Ashland County.  Memory is not clear as to what happened.  Witness not answer questions due to self-incrimination.  Witness identifies her signature on exhibit #1.  Witness identifies the photos are of her.  Do not remember Officer Fleig taking the photos.  
Re-direct by Atty Rafferty.  Did not read the statement before signing it.  Do not remember speaking with Officer Pilath in Ashland County.  Drank 2-12 oz. beers earlier this morning; am not impaired right now.  
Re-cross by DA Bourg.  Witness is excused.
Theresa Kantorski sworn and questioned by Atty Rafferty.  Theresa Thoreson is her neighbor and friend.  See her every day.  Witness views exhibits #3 and #4; did see the red marks on her the morning after the incident.  Theresa's daughter was her roommate at the time of this incident.  Text messages were rec'd by Daniel and Kateri Bender asking her to come and get their Mom.  
No cross by DA.  Defense rests.
DA recalls Officer Fleig.  Court reminds Witness he is still under oath.  DA Bourg questions Witness.  James Hill and daughter Brianna were present when statement was being prepared.  Victim indicated she was in fear of her life.  
Cross by Atty Rafferty.  Did not give her a PBT, or ask her if she was under the influence.  Court excuses Witness.
DA Bourg makes argument to the Court; asks for bind over.
Atty Rafferty makes argument to the Court.
DA Bourg rebuttal comments.
Court:  Satisfied the State did not prove count 2 of False Imprisonment.  Satisfied evidence is reliable and finds probable cause on count 1 of Strangulation and Suffication; binds over on count 1.  
Atty Rafferty addresses Motion to Modify Bond with the Court.  Showing today there is doubt in this case.  Requests S/B or C/B no more than $1,000.00.  Will reside w/ his father, comply with bail monitoring.  Asks he be allowed to leave State of Wisconsin with the approval of DOC.  Been in jail for 104 days.  
DA Bourg responds; met with VA Director Johnson.  Not opposed to a S/B if Mr. Thoreson would be inpatient through the VA treatment program.  May be additional charges in MN. with an unserved jail sentence there.  No change in circumstances since C/B was set by the Court.  
Atty Rafferty responds.  Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection submitted by the Defendant's Attorney
from Atty. Snyder regarding his representation
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance for witness to appear and give evidence on January 23, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
Status conference on January 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
